channel.title: FW1 [It's Dead, Jim]
channel.description:
## First!
## Also I am hosting a Werewolf game woo ## This is just to see if forumgoers are interested in playing Werewolf/Mafia/ToL on the forums
###Taken over by ya boi Jordarrian
----------
Rules:
1. No messaging other players 2. Respect other players and the mod 3. You must talk at least once every 24 hours, or you will be prodded and have 16 hours to respond. Not responding at that point will get you kicked from the game. Post that do not have actual game content will not be counted. 4. No spam posts 5. Do not speak when you die, not even to complain about something. 6. No editing posts. You will be warned the first time. Next time it happens, you will be punished. 7. Have fun!
**Roles and what they do** [color=red]**Werewolves**[/color] - Eat a player every night - win if they have equal number to Village [color=blue]**Villagers**[/color] - No Abilities - win if they kill all the Werewolves [color=blue]**Seer**[/color] - Check a player every night to see if they are a werewolf - wins with villagers [color=blue]**Hunter**[/color] - Kill 1 player immediately if executed - wins with villagers [color=orange]**Tanner**[/color] - If executed, the next day does not happen - wins if executed
**How the game will work** Each day phase will be 72 hours (3 days) long, each night will be 24 hours Everyone will be sent a role via Private Message and be given 24 hours to reply, confirming the receipt of the role, or they will be replaced Werewolves will be able to talk to each other at night
**Executions** Vote a player by saying "**/vote [name]**" Once a player reaches 51% majority votes, they die, the day ends and the night begins If they day runs out of time, the player with the most votes dies, if there is a tie, the player who reached that number of votes first will die
**Role List** [color=blue]**Seer**[/color] [color=blue]**Hunter**[/color] [color=blue]**Villager**[/color] [color=blue]**Villager**[/color] [color=blue]**Villager**[/color] [color=blue]**Villager**[/color] [color=blue]**Villager**[/color]
[color=red]**Werewolf**[/color] [color=red]**Werewolf**[/color]
[color=orange]**Tanner**[/color]
**Joining** To join, simply express interest in joining by saying something like "I want to join" or "/join" or "/in" or "sign me up, coach" or whatever you want
**Players** 2. Frostwolf103 3. JammySplodge 4. FadeBlade 5. Unknown 6. orangeandblack5 7. Queen Alfa 8. Alexandrite 9. Gazelda 10. deadfrien
**Grave** 1. Xerxes
**Timeline** [Night 1/Day 2](http://forum.imperium42.com/t/fw1-day-2-one-down/243/83?u=jordarrian)

item.title: FW1 [It's Dead, Jim]
item.dc:creator: Gazelda
item.description:
(( My apologies for my misunderstanding of the matter. This was literally the first time I’ve ever participated in a more traditional Mafia/Werewolf game, whether on a forum or off. You definitely have more experience than I do, orangeandblack. I’d think in the case of this particular game, though, that it’s a fairly typical lineup of roles for both Mafia and Werewolf, so in this case there’d be an equal chance that something like this would happen, given this situation no matter the theme. But then again…what would I really know about it in practice? ))

Read full topic

item.title: FW1 [It's Dead, Jim]
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
I’m fully aware that there is a theme difference only

But, the way most of these games [keyword: most] end up being structured is very different. Sure, you can give the Werewolf faction allies that have different powers, and sure, you can keep the Mafia entirely Goons, but that’s not how it usually works out.

Read full topic

item.title: FW1 [It's Dead, Jim]
item.dc:creator: Gazelda
item.description:
(( JammySplodge is right. The only real difference between Mafia and traditional Werewolf is thematic. Roles have an equivalent in both, e.g. seer and cop/detective or werewolf and mafioso. ))

(( You want even more people saying the same thing in an organized manner? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mafia_(party_game) has got you covered. ))

Read full topic

item.description:
They’re exactly the same
The roles have different names
Setups aren’t based on theming they’re based on who think what roles work best where

Read full topic

item.title: FW1 [It's Dead, Jim]
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
No. Most games with Werewolves see many citizens and only a power role or two. Most games with Mafia have citizens, but several more power roles on both sides.

Read full topic

item.title: FW1 [It's Dead, Jim]

item.description:
That may be so
But you just said that Mafia is likely to be less involved than Mafia

item.title: FW1 [It's Dead, Jim]
item.dc:creator: Gazelda
item.description:
[yawns] I’m awake, though mostly silent both out of choice and out of the mere fact that I’m frequently still half-asleep when summoned… But, it seems few others are awake and ready for any sort of discussion at all. That’s unfortunate.

(( posted some reasoning behind much of my own lesser activity in a wall of text on the Discord - but besides what I’ve posted, I think that if we run something like this again we may need a few more ways to reach the people involved and to kindly remind them that there’s this one forum game people should contribute to when they can, should they see reason to contribute. I don’t check the forums often enough for a mere PM here to reach me immediately, for example. And not everyone keeps the ToL Discord channel entirely unmuted - I personally have it muted for everything except @mentions like @[name] or @[rank], @here, or @all. That way, I can see major announcements and the like, but I don’t get a notification every single time someone posts a in off-topic chat or something like that. At the very least, more lines of communication may save games like these from people not being eaten by werewolves during the second night because, for example, no one on the werewolf team saw or otherwise realized that it was night time and they had to make a decision on such important things as their dietary needs. ))

Read full topic
